definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Would you mind keeping your nose out of my family?
sentences.chinese: 你可以别管我的家事吗？

sentences.english: Your two of a kind, neither of you care about detail nor domestics.
sentences.chinese: 你们是两个同类，都对家事和细节满不在乎。

sentences.english: But rather than keep it in the family, Fukuyama went public.
sentences.chinese: 他没有把这当成家事，而是公之于众。

sentences.english: And Jotham his son succeeded him as king.
sentences.chinese: 他儿子约坦管理家事，治理国民。

sentences.english: Because my parents have to work, we do the housework.
sentences.chinese: 因为爸妈要上班，家事都由我们来做。

sentences.english: Shen heart rarely talk about the housework, but everybody could see that she had not equal to idea.
sentences.chinese: 沈心很少谈论家事，但明眼人都看得出她过得不如意。

sentences.english: You have to do the housework.
The 100% coconut oil soap is a perfect household soap.
sentences.chinese: 这100%椰油家事皂一直是婆婆妈妈的最爱。

sentences.english: Besides, this is my family matter. You should stay out of it.
sentences.chinese: 另外，这是我的家事，你最好与此撇清关系。

sentences.english: But that woman has not happened, all the family are oak Nguyen care of a person.
sentences.chinese: 但那女人并未出现过，所有家事都是阮栎一个人打理。

sentences.english: Zhuo poem Chengzhe complain much, she and her brother in the family.
sentences.chinese: 卓诗埋怨成哲多事，插手自己与弟弟的家事。

sentences.english: She fell in love with a family-man.
sentences.chinese: 她爱上了一个有家事的男人。

sentences.english: Mrs. Wong hires a housemaid to help the houseworks.
sentences.chinese: 王太太请了个佣人来帮忙做家事。

sentences.english: The third-rate wife is a nag and complainer.
sentences.chinese: 三等太太，唠叨不休，嫌怪家事。

sentences.english: That's the way a real woman handles her business, even when it's about a broken heart.
sentences.chinese: 这就是一个真正的女人处理家事，即使她伤心欲绝。

definition: even an honest and upright official will have difficulty resolving a family dispute (proverb)
pinyin: qing1 guan1 nan2 duan4 jia1 wu4 shi4

definition: to show an interest in/to get involved with
lit. family shames must not be spread abroad (idiom)/fig. don't wash your dirty linen in public
pinyin: jia1 chou3 bu4 ke3 wai4 yang2

definition: Every family goes through its problems. (idiom)
pinyin: jia1 jia1 you3 ben3 nan2 nian4 de5 jing1

definition: lit. to go beyond the sacrificial altar and take over the kitchen (idiom); fig. to exceed one's place and meddle in other people's affairs/to take matters into one's own hands
major turning point of lifelong import (esp. marriage)
